subject: GGOV
title: Global Governance
description:
This course provides an overview of current scholarly debates relating to the interdisciplinary study of global govemance in the context of globalization. It examines competing perspectives on globalization and global govemance, and
explores the sources and consequences of global power and authority, as well as the key actors, institutions, regimes, and norms of global governance. This course is open only to students in the PhD program in Global Govemance.
